name: Allen Falayi
headline: Computer Engineering Student @ Georgia Tech
about: I am a third year student at the Georgia Institute of Technology. Currently I am pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering with a minor in Spanish, maintaining a GPA of 3.6. I possess deep understanding of both hardware and software principles, and my hands-on projects have honed my skills in digital design and programming. Whether it's developing efficient algorithms in Python, crafting robust applications in Java, or diving into high-level MIPS Assembly code, I thrive on the challenge of solving complex problems and bringing creative solutions to life. In addition to my technical skills, I bring strong analytical abilities, effective communication, and a collaborative mindset. My proficiency in Spanish has provided me with a global perspective and the ability to communicate effectively with diverse groups.

experiences.title: Research Assistant - Human Neuromuscular Physiology Laboratory

surface HD-EMG signals.
- Optimized Matlab code to generate visual representations of stimulation data, and enhanced usability via prompts.

about: Hello! I'm a student at Georgia Tech with a passion for everything related to the world of computer science. Programming makes things easier and more efficient, and I plan on using its power to solve problems with real world impact. experiences.title: LLM Researcher
experiences.description:
Researched LLM data loss (lost-in-the-middle issue) with long-context inputs using needle-in-a-haystack test.
Tested new technique using artificial pause tokens to improve information processing and redistribute attention.
Identified a ~10% improvement in data retention, potentially expanding LLM utility for long-context use cases.
Accepted to NAACL Student Research Workshop 2025.

name: Shraddha Bhat
headline: Systems and Infrastructure Engineer III, Information Security @ Walmart Inc.
about:
As a Graduate Teaching Assistant at Georgia Tech, I support the delivery of the Secure Computer Systems course, where I assist students with assignments, lecture content, and projects. I am also pursuing a master's degree in Cybersecurity, with a focus on Cloud Security, Network Security, and SOC/IR.

Previously, I worked as an IAM intern at First Advantage, where I performed access reviews, implemented identity governance policies, and automated IAM processes using PowerShell, Microsoft Entra and Saviynt. I also gained valuable experience in Cloud Security and Compliance, as I helped migrate applications to AWS and ensured adherence to security standards and best practices. Additionally, I hold multiple certifications, including SSCP, CIAM, and AWS Cloud Practitioner, which demonstrate my knowledge and skills in various domains of Cybersecurity.

With four years of practical experience and academic excellence, I am passionate about learning and developing new skills in the field of Cybersecurity. I am driven by curiosity and innovation, and I aim to contribute effectively to cutting-edge security strategies, initiatives, and solutions.

name: Akshita Jha
headline: CS + BME @ Georgia Tech | ML + Fluid Mechanics Intern @ CFM Lab
about: I am a Machine Learning Engineering and Data Analyst with a focus on using advanced technologies and financial systems to create impactful results in biomedical engineering.During my internships, I developed strong skills in machine learning, artificial intelligence, and biomedical engineering. At the Cardiovascular Fluid Mechanics Lab, I built machine learning models using Python that accurately predicted post-TAVR aortic arch stretch, reducing surgical planning time by 25%. My work with AI improved predictive model accuracy by 15%, boosting overall efficiency by 18%.As a Biomedical Engineer Intern at MiRus, I designed new medical devices using SolidWorks, which increased procedural success rates by 29%. I also coordinated with over 50 suppliers to ensure timely delivery and quality of materials, effectively managing project schedules and budgets.In my role at Flow MedTech, I led a team to run simulations that improved device reliability and reduced failure rates by 25%. This experience also helped me enhance financial strategies, resulting in a 20% increase in asset value.I have a passion for data science. One of my projects involved creating statistical shape models of the aortic root using ShapeWorks and Blender, which improved model accuracy by 28% and reduced costs by 12%.I am skilled in programming languages and software like Python, MATLAB, SolidWorks, and ShapeWorks. I also hold certifications in Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and various biomedical research areas.Connect with me via LinkedIn or Email (akshita.j1702@gmail.com) to see how my skills in machine learning, AI, financial systems, and biomedical engineering can benefit your projects.

projects.project_name: Statistical Shape Models of the Aortic Root
projects.description: Utilized Python and ShapeWorks to build statistical shape models of the aortic root from CT scans, enhancing model accuracy by 28%, reducing costs by 12%, and boosting research efficiency and profitability.

Developed a neurotrauma registry using Python, Django, and PostgreSQL, enhancing patient data management for over 7 million people, with 30% improved data access and 50% faster, more reliable deployment through Docker.
